Text:
dohduhdah, I just don't know how to thank you for this wonderful upload. I have downloaded and seeded (still doing) few of your other TTC lecture videos and this is the first time I have commented (Couldn't resist myself anymore to thank you heartily.) 

m/
thnx mate , plz upload The Science of Natural Healing .if u can spare the time , I m greatly indebted to u already
WARNING: This file is password protected. If somebody is able to figure out this password and post it here!!!

@NL-Birdie:
There is no password. These are video files that can be opened in VLC media player.
Dear dohduhdah, I create this account just to tell you that I genuinely appreciate and admire your wonderful work. Please keep it up! Thank you so much! No one can hold a candle to you!
Thanks a lot for this upload. Appreciate it.

Hi dohduhdah,

Please read this.

I come from a poor family, my dad is mentally disabled and my mom worked manual labor for support me my sister and my dad.

I ended up getting going to college for engineering but my k-12 schooling was shit. Schools in poor neighborhoods really are shit. I need these videos to refresh my skills and you have everything related to math.

Knowledge should NOT be restricted to kids who have inherited money from their parents (i.e., those who have not earned it).

It is (in my system of ethics) immoral.

Whatever reason you are doing what you are doing, know that you are really saving lives of people who love knowledge yet are denied access due to what their parents failed to do in life.

If you pm me on the forum, I'd be happy to send you books I've scanned (I cut up my books and scan them for convenience). I don't know how torrenting works and I don't care about credit.

I'll also buy you a beer if you want.

Thanks for the up, a friend was talking about photography stuff and i had no idea what she was saying... but when i saw her photos i got it!

Though i don't believe education should be free, i do believe in our society it's treated too much of a commodity and is overpriced and overvalued.

For anyone interested they have some free online courses at MIT, http://ocw.mit.edu/courses/find-by-topic/
Dohduhdah, do you have the course 'Religion in the Ancient Mediterranean World'? Please upload it. I can't find it anywhere.
